greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows. Let S(k) be the sequence defined by F(0)=0, F(1)=1, F(n-1) + (n+k)*F(n) = F(n+1). E.g. S(0) = 0, 1, 1, 3, 10, 43, 225, 1393, 9976, 81201, ... Then S(0), S(1), S(2), ... are written vertically, next to each other, with the initial term of each on the next row down.
comment: T(n,1) = A001040(n); T(n,k) = A058294(n,n+k-1), k = 1..n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 14 2014
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..7875
xref: Mirror image of triangle in A102473.
results.author: _Russell Walsmith_, Jan 09 2005
ext: Entry revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 09 2005
